name: Crisis Diversion Team
operator: REACH Edmonton (via Hope Mission & Boyle Street Community Services)
description: 24/7 mobile crisis response for vulnerable individuals likely to come to harm without intervention. Dispatched through 211 Alberta (press 3). CMHA Edmonton is a key partner. Partnership between REACH Edmonton, Hope Mission, and Boyle Street.
coverageDescription: City of Edmonton — Hope Mission covers 5 vans (day up to 7, night up to 4), Boyle Street covers 6 vans
accessNotes: Publicly accessible. Anyone can call 211 press 3 to request a team.
transportNotes: Can transport individuals to shelters, detox, hospitals, and other services. All transport is voluntary.

verification.notes: Hours and contact info from web research, not confirmed with operator

name: Hope Mission CDT Vans
description: CDT vans operated by Hope Mission. 5 vans base, up to 7 daytime, up to 4 nighttime.
accessNotes: Dispatched through CDT 211+3 system
transportNotes: 5 vans (up to 7 day, up to 4 night)

verification.notes: Van counts and hours from research conversations

name: Boyle Street CDT Vans
description: CDT vans operated by Boyle Street Community Services. 6 vans.
accessNotes: Dispatched through CDT 211+3 system

verification.notes: Van counts and hours from research conversations

name: Hope Mission — Herb Jamieson Centre
description: Emergency shelter for adult men. Walk-in intake, meals, basic health services, case management.
accessNotes: Walk-in. Open door intake for adult men.

verification.notes: Phone verified via hopemission.com/locations/edmonton (Feb 2026)

name: Boyle Street Community Services — King Thunderbird Centre
description: Drop-in centre providing meals, health services, housing support, and community connections for people experiencing homelessness and poverty. Relocated to King Thunderbird Centre in Dec 2025.
accessNotes: Walk-in during operating hours. No referral needed.

verification.notes: Well-known facility, hours from web research

name: UHEI — Unsheltered Homelessness & Encampments Initiative
description: Responds to calls from EPS regarding encampments. Supports closure and transition of individuals to services. Part of federal UHEI funding ($35M nationally).
coverageDescription: Responds to EPS calls regarding encampments citywide
accessNotes: Responds to EPS calls only. Not publicly dispatched.
transportNotes: Can transport individuals from encampments to services

verification.notes: Pilot program — funding and continuation status needs verification

name: Health Access Mobile Team
description: Receives referrals from RAH Navigators. Supports transportation from Royal Alexandra Hospital to medical centres and/or shelters.
coverageDescription: RAH → medical centres and shelters. Referral-based from RAH Navigators.
accessNotes: Referrals received from RAH Navigators only. Not publicly accessible.
transportNotes: Transports from RAH to medical centres and shelters

verification.notes: UNVERIFIABLE: Zero public web presence (Feb 2026). Name not found on hopemission.com, InformAlberta, 211, or news. May be internal name, defunct pilot, or absorbed into Bridge Healing program. Pilot ends 2026-03-31. NEEDS PHONE CALL: Hope Mission 780-422-2018 to confirm existence.

name: Bus Connect
description: Winter warming bus providing shelter and transport. West loop route. Normal operations M-F 11:30-7:30.
coverageDescription: West loop route. Winter operations 24/7, normal operations M-F 11:30am-7:30pm.

hours.notes: Winter 24/7 west loop. Normal M-F 11:30-7:30. Phone 1130-730.

accessNotes: Publicly accessible. Can board at route stops.
transportNotes: Mobile warming bus with west loop route

verification.notes: Pilot program — funding and continuation status needs verification

name: Streetworks Mobile Outreach
description: Harm reduction, needle exchange, and mobile outreach via van. Operates 7 evenings per week.
coverageDescription: Downtown core and surrounding neighbourhoods. Evening mobile van outreach.

hours.notes: Mobile van operates 7 evenings per week

accessNotes: Publicly accessible during operating hours. No transport provided.

verification.notes: Hours updated to 7 evenings/week per boylestreet.org/post/streetworks (Feb 2026).

name: Mobile Outreach Addictions Team
description: Mobile addictions outreach team from Boyle Street Community Services. Provides harm reduction supplies, addictions counselling referrals, and connects individuals struggling with substance use to treatment and support services. Weekdays 9am–5pm.
accessNotes: Publicly accessible during operating hours.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). Boyle Street operated. Hours unverified for 2026.

name: Community Outreach Transit Team
operator: City of Edmonton Peace Officers, Outreach Workers & Bent Arrow Traditional Healing Society
description: Peace officers, outreach workers, and Bent Arrow Traditional Healing Society supporting vulnerable individuals in the transit system. Can provide transport. PO referrals only.
coverageDescription: Edmonton transit system — LRT stations, transit centres, bus routes. 7 teams.
accessNotes: PO referrals only. Not directly accessible by public.
transportNotes: Can provide transport from transit locations to services

verification.notes: Hours and contact info from web research, not confirmed with operator

name: Transit Peace Officers
description: Patrol ETS/LRT stations 24/7. Fare compliance, safety. Can provide transport. Transit Watch line: 780-442-4900 for immediate safety concerns.
accessNotes: Available at transit stations. Can approach directly.

verification.notes: Hours updated to 24/7 per edmonton.ca/ets/safety-and-security (Feb 2026). Transit Watch line 780-442-4900 confirmed.

name: Park Rangers
description: Patrol Edmonton river valley parks and trails 7 days/week. Can assist people in distress, connect to services via 311, and report encampments. Not a crisis response team but often first to encounter vulnerable individuals in green spaces.
coverageDescription: Edmonton river valley parks and trails
accessNotes: Available in river valley parks.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). River valley patrols 7 days/week confirmed.

name: Community Standards / By-Law
description: By-law enforcement. 6 days a week (closed Sundays and statutory holidays).
accessNotes: Call 311 for by-law concerns.

verification.notes: Hours updated to 7am-7pm, 6 days/wk (closed Sun & stat holidays) per edmonton.ca/programs_services/311-city-services (Feb 2026).

name: Low-Risk Encampment Response
operator: City of Edmonton Peace Officers & Outreach
description: Coordinated response to low-risk encampments. Peace officers and outreach workers engage residents, offer connections to shelter, housing, and support services before camp closure. Referrals to CDT, shelters, and social services. M–F 8am–4pm.
coverageDescription: Responds to low-risk encampment reports citywide
accessNotes: Not publicly accessible. Coordinated through 311 and peace officers.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). PO + outreach coordinated response. Hours M–F 8am–4pm from research.

name: High-Risk Encampment Response
operator: City of Edmonton Peace Officers & EPS
description: Joint peace officer and EPS response to high-risk encampments involving safety concerns (weapons, fires, hazardous materials). Outreach offered alongside enforcement. Residents connected to emergency shelters and services where possible. M–F 8am–4pm.
coverageDescription: Responds to high-risk encampment situations citywide
accessNotes: Not publicly accessible. Joint PO and EPS response.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). Joint PO + EPS response. Hours M–F 8am–4pm from research.

name: EPS Patrol
description: 24/7 patrol responding to emergency 911 calls. Officers can connect people in crisis to CDT (211+3), PACT, or transport to hospital. First responders for high-risk situations involving violence, weapons, or immediate danger.
accessNotes: Call 911 for emergencies.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). 24/7 patrol, connections to CDT/PACT confirmed.

name: EPS Beat Officers
description: Officers on foot patrol in downtown core and high-activity areas. Engage with community members and businesses. Can connect vulnerable individuals to H.E.L.P. navigators, CDT, or other services. Hours vary by area (typically 6am–10pm).
coverageDescription: Downtown core and high-activity areas. Hours vary depending on area of city.

hours.notes: Hours vary depending on area of city

accessNotes: Can approach directly on foot.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). Foot patrol in downtown + high-activity areas. Hours vary by area.

name: H.E.L.P. — Officers & Navigators
description: EPS officers paired with social navigators who provide case management for vulnerable individuals who frequently interact with police. Build relationships, connect to housing, treatment, and social services. Internal EPS referral — not publicly accessible.
coverageDescription: Supports EPS officers citywide. Case management and navigation.
accessNotes: EPS referrals only. Not publicly accessible.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). Officers + social navigators. Internal EPS program — not publicly accessible.

name: Community Paramedics
description: Mobile acute medical care for individuals experiencing homelessness, addiction, or mental health issues. Everyday 8am-8pm.
accessNotes: Call 1-833-367-2788 to request. For individuals experiencing homelessness, active addiction, or acute mental health distress who need medical assessment but not ER. No referral needed.

verification.notes: Description and access notes enriched (Feb 2026). Phone 1-833-367-2788 is AHS referral line. Serves field updated.

name: Community Response Team
description: 6 AHS teams each with a nurse or paramedic. Provide acute medical care and assessment in home/community settings for individuals who don't need emergency department but need more than a phone call. Daily 8am–8pm. No transport provided.
accessNotes: Call 1-833-367-2788. For individuals needing nursing/paramedic assessment at home — acute illness, wound care, medication concerns. Must meet clinical criteria assessed on intake call.

verification.notes: Description and access notes enriched (Feb 2026). 6 teams confirmed. Phone 1-833-367-2788 is AHS general line.

name: City Centre Team
description: AHS mobile team focused on Edmonton's downtown core. Provides medical assessment, crisis response, and referrals for individuals experiencing homelessness, addiction, or mental health issues. Daily 8am–8pm.
accessNotes: Operates in downtown core. Can be reached via AHS at 1-833-367-2788. Encounters individuals during patrols or responds to requests from other services.

verification.notes: Description and access notes enriched (Feb 2026). AHS internal team, limited public documentation.

name: Access 24/7 — Mental Health & Addiction
description: 24/7 mental health and addiction support. Walk-in and phone. Located at Anderson Hall.
accessNotes: Walk-in and phone, both 24/7. No referral needed. Located at Anderson Hall (Royal Alexandra Hospital campus).

verification.notes: Phone 780-424-2424 confirmed correct (multiple sources). ADDRESS CONFLICT: Anderson Hall (10959 102 St) vs Fort Rd Hub (13211 Fort Rd NW) — 211.ca and InformAlberta show Fort Rd. Walk-in hours may be 8am-10pm at new location (phone still 24/7). Operator may now be Recovery Alberta. NEEDS PHONE CALL TO CONFIRM.

name: PACT — Police & Crisis Team
description: EPS officer and mental health therapist paired team. Assess individual mental health status. Can apprehend based on Mental Health Act. 24/7.
accessNotes: Not publicly accessible. Dispatched through EPS or AHS.
transportNotes: Can transport to hospital for mental health assessment under Mental Health Act

verification.notes: AHS service details from web research, not confirmed with AHS

name: CREMS — Crisis Response & EMS
description: Paramedic and mental health therapist team. Provide mental health and crisis intervention in community. 24/7.
coverageDescription: Citywide — paramedic + mental health crisis response
accessNotes: Not publicly accessible. Dispatched through AHS.
transportNotes: Can transport to hospital or crisis services

verification.notes: UNVERIFIABLE: 'CREMS' not found in any public source (Feb 2026). Connection to PACT added. Phone 1-833-367-2788 is AHS general line. ASK WORKING GROUP for public-facing name.

name: DATS — Dedicated Accessible Transit Service
description: Transit service for physical/cognitive disability. Application form required for eligibility. Booking required in advance.
accessNotes: Application form required for eligibility. Physical/cognitive disability.

verification.notes: City service, well-documented. Booking hours updated per edmonton.ca/ets/dats (Feb 2026).

name: DBA Core Patrol
description: 24/7 safety patrol within Downtown Business Association boundaries. 2 staff, 2 vehicles managed by HireGood. Privately funded for 2026 ($330K from National Bank). Respond to safety concerns, provide outreach and referrals to services for vulnerable individuals encountered in the downtown core.
coverageDescription: Downtown Business Association boundaries — core downtown area
accessNotes: Operates within DBA boundaries. Can approach patrol staff.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). 2 staff, 2 vehicles, $330K funding from National Bank. No public phone found — contact DBA.

name: Stoney Plain Road BIA Navigators
description: 2 outreach navigators patrolling the Stoney Plain Road BIA area 4 days/week. Connect vulnerable individuals to services, provide referrals, and support businesses dealing with social disorder. HireGood operations. 4-month pilot launched Nov 2025.
coverageDescription: Stoney Plain Road BIA area — west end
accessNotes: Can approach navigators in BIA area.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). 4-month pilot launched Nov 2025. No public phone found — contact Stoney Plain Rd BIA.

name: Old Strathcona On-Call
description: On-call safety and outreach service in Old Strathcona/Whyte Avenue area. HireGood staff respond to safety concerns from businesses and community members. Connect vulnerable individuals to services and provide referrals.
accessNotes: On-call within Old Strathcona BIA area.

verification.notes: Description enriched (Feb 2026). On-call service, HireGood staff. No public phone found — contact Old Strathcona BIA.

name: George Spady Centre — Detox (Aurora Centre)
description: Medically supported detox (withdrawal management) at Aurora Centre. 41 detox beds + 19 pre-treatment recovery beds (60 total). Walk-in triage daily 8:30–9:30am at southwest door. No doctor referral needed. 24-hour phone line. Opened Aug 2025, replacing downtown location.
address: 15625 Stony Plain Road NW, Edmonton, AB
accessNotes: Walk-in triage daily 8:30–9:30am at southwest door of Aurora Centre. No doctor referral needed. For intoxicated adults needing safe sobering and medically supported withdrawal. Call 780-424-8335 (24hrs) for out-of-town or special circumstances.

verification.notes: Triage hours 8:30–9:30am verified from gspady.org (Feb 2026). Aurora Centre relocation Aug 2025 confirmed. 41 detox + 19 pre-treatment beds.

name: George Spady Aurora Centre — Pre-Treatment Program
description: Pre-treatment bridge program at Aurora Centre (same building as detox). 19 beds for individuals transitioning from withdrawal management to formal addiction treatment programs. No separate intake — admitted through detox program.
address: 15625 Stony Plain Road NW, Edmonton, AB
accessNotes: Walk-in with intake assessment. Crisis stabilization.

verification.notes: Pre-treatment program confirmed at Aurora Centre (Feb 2026). 19 beds. Restructured as child of george-spady-detox. Details approximate.

name: Ambrose Place — NiGiNan Housing Ventures
description: Indigenous-led permanent supportive housing. 42 units. 24/7 wraparound services. Harm reduction model with managed alcohol/cannabis programs. Cultural supports with Elders.
accessNotes: Not a drop-in or emergency shelter. Permanent supportive housing with application process.

verification.notes: Phone updated to 780-784-6150 per niginan.ca and Yellow Pages (Feb 2026). Not emergency shelter — housing program.

name: Royal Alexandra Hospital
description: Major hospital with emergency department. Inner-city location, significant volume of crisis-related cases.
accessNotes: Emergency department open 24/7.

verification.notes: Standard hospital hours assumed, should verify psychiatric emergency capacity

name: University of Alberta Hospital
description: Major hospital with emergency and psychiatric services.
accessNotes: Emergency department open 24/7.

verification.notes: Standard hospital hours assumed, should verify psychiatric emergency capacity

name: Youth Empowerment & Support Services
description: Emergency shelter for youth aged 15-21 experiencing homelessness. Daytime programs serve ages 15-24.
accessNotes: Emergency shelter for youth aged 15-21. Daytime programs serve ages 15-24. Walk-in during intake hours.

verification.notes: Well-known youth service, age ranges from web research

name: 988 Suicide Crisis Helpline
operator: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH)
description: National suicide crisis helpline. Call or text 988 for immediate support. Available 24/7 in English and French. Launched Nov 2023.
accessNotes: Anyone can call or text 988. Free, confidential, 24/7.

verification.notes: National service, details well-documented

name: Mustard Seed — Central Shelter
description: 124-bed emergency shelter open to all adults. Walk-in, behaviour-based admission. Dry facility (being under the influence is not grounds for refusal). Nurse-led health services, meals, showers, housing case management. Opened Dec 2023.
accessNotes: Walk-in. Emergency shelter for adults.

verification.notes: Phone updated to 780-919-1735 (theseed.ca + alberta.ca, Feb 2026). Description enriched with bed count, admission policy, services.

name: Mustard Seed — Strathcona Shelter
description: 45-bed emergency shelter open to all adults on Edmonton's south side. Walk-in admission. Meals, hot showers, laundry, hygiene supplies, and advocacy services.
accessNotes: Walk-in. Emergency shelter for adults.

verification.notes: Phone updated to 780-619-9885 (theseed.ca + alberta.ca, Feb 2026). Description enriched with bed count and services.

name: Edmonton Distress Line
description: 24/7 confidential phone support for anyone in distress. Call 780-482-HELP (4357).
accessNotes: Anyone can call. Free, confidential, 24/7.

verification.notes: CMHA Edmonton well-known service. Phone confirmed via cmhaedmonton.ca (Feb 2026).

name: iHuman Youth Society
description: 120 daytime shelter spaces for vulnerable youth. Arts-based programming and support services.

hours.notes: Daytime drop-in hours — verify exact schedule with iHuman.

accessNotes: Youth drop-in. Arts-based programming for vulnerable youth.

verification.notes: Address and phone from ihumanyouthsociety.org. Exact hours need verification.

name: 211 Alberta
description: Provincial information and referral helpline. Press 3 for Crisis Diversion Team dispatch.
accessNotes: Anyone can call 211. Press 3 for crisis diversion.

verification.notes: Well-known provincial service

name: Edmonton Police Service
description: Municipal police service. Entry point for emergency response via 911. Non-emergency line: 780-423-4567.
accessNotes: Call 911 for emergencies. Non-emergency: 780-423-4567.

verification.notes: Well-known municipal service

name: E4C — Women's Emergency Accommodation Centre
description: Emergency shelter for women (~64 beds). Registration begins 7am daily, intake list renews daily — individuals contacted as beds become available. Meals (3/day), showers, laundry, safe medication administration, outreach support, housing placement assistance.
accessNotes: Women only. Registration begins 7am daily. Intake list renews each day — individuals contacted as beds become available. Walk-in to register, then wait for callback. 780-423-5302.

verification.notes: Phone 780-423-5302 and address verified (211.ca + alberta.ca, Feb 2026). ~64 beds. Registration 7am daily.

name: Wîhcihaw Maskokamik — Enoch Cree Nation Emergency Shelter
description: Indigenous-operated emergency shelter at the former Coliseum Inn. ~100 beds. Intake hours 7am–7pm daily (not a walk-in drop-in — intake must be completed first). Culturally safe emergency accommodation. Three meals/day, showers, on-site housing support.
address: 11845 Wayne Gretzky Drive NW, Edmonton, AB
accessNotes: Intake hours 7am–7pm daily. Not a walk-in drop-in — individuals must complete intake process before receiving shelter services. All genders 18+. Call 587-525-8222.

verification.notes: Phone 587-525-8222 found (211.ca + alberta.ca, Feb 2026). ~100 beds per Homeward Trust. Intake hours 7am–7pm approximate — still needs direct verification.

name: Community of Hope — Elizabeth Fry Society
operator: Elizabeth Fry Society of Northern Alberta
description: Emergency shelter for women and gender-diverse individuals aged 18+. Up to 96 beds. First come, first served. 24/7 operation. Located at Station Pointe near Belvedere LRT.
accessNotes: Emergency shelter for women and gender-diverse individuals.

verification.notes: Phone 587-735-5000 found (efrynorthernalberta.com + alberta.ca, Feb 2026). 96 beds confirmed. Intake process needs verification.

name: WIN House — Women in Need
description: Emergency shelter for women and children fleeing domestic violence. Address confidential for safety. 24-hour crisis line available.
accessNotes: For women and children fleeing domestic violence. Call crisis line first. Address confidential.

verification.notes: Connections to lurana-shelter and e4c-weac added (Feb 2026). Phone from domesticshelters.org. Address intentionally confidential.

name: Lurana Shelter
description: 32-bed emergency shelter for women and children fleeing domestic violence. Address confidential for safety.
accessNotes: For women and children fleeing domestic violence. Call crisis line first. Address confidential.

verification.notes: Connection to e4c-weac added (Feb 2026). Phone from domesticshelters.org. Address intentionally confidential.

name: Family Violence Info Line
description: Provincial 24/7 crisis line for family violence. Call or text 310-1818 (no area code needed). Multilingual support available.
accessNotes: Anyone can call or text 310-1818. Free, confidential, 24/7. No area code needed.

verification.notes: Provincial government service. Confirmed via alberta.ca/family-violence-find-supports (Feb 2026).

name: CAST — Crisis and Stabilization Team (Children & Youth)
description: Immediate crisis support for children and youth ages 5-17 and their care providers. Phone-based crisis intervention and stabilization.
coverageDescription: Edmonton Zone — crisis support for children/youth 5-17

hours.notes: Crisis line available 24/7 — verify if mobile response hours differ

accessNotes: Anyone can call for a child/youth in crisis. Ages 5-17.

verification.notes: Connection to 988 added (Feb 2026). Phone 780-407-1000 confirmed via 211 Alberta.

name: Kids Help Phone
description: National 24/7 crisis line for young people. Call 1-800-668-6868 or text CONNECT to 686868. Professional counsellors available.
accessNotes: Anyone can call or text. Free, confidential, 24/7. Text CONNECT to 686868.

verification.notes: Connection to distress-line added (Feb 2026). National service, well-documented.

name: MMIWG Crisis Line
description: 24/7 crisis line providing emotional support and crisis referral for those affected by the issue of Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls.
accessNotes: Anyone can call. Free, confidential, 24/7. Culturally safe support.

verification.notes: Federal government service. Phone confirmed via multiple sources (Feb 2026).

name: Alberta Mental Health Help Line
description: Provincial 24/7 mental health crisis line. Confidential crisis intervention, information, and referral to local services.
accessNotes: Anyone can call. Free, confidential, 24/7.

verification.notes: Connection to family-violence-line added (Feb 2026). Provincial service confirmed via recoveryalberta.ca.
